Uses of Interface
org.mfg.mdb.runtime.IRecord

  • Packages that use IRecord 
    Package Description
    org.mfg.mdb.demo
    Examples of the common use cases of MDB.
    org.mfg.mdb.runtime
    The MDB Runtime provides the API to create, modify and read the MDB files.

    • Uses of IRecord in org.mfg.mdb.demo

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Demo_02_PriceMDB.Record
      Demo_02_Price record structure.

      Classes in org.mfg.mdb.runtime with type parameters of type IRecord 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  IAppender<T extends IRecord>
      Common interface for all the appenders.
      interface  ICursor<T extends IRecord>
      Common interface for all cursors.
      interface  IRandomCursor<T extends IRecord>
      Common interface for all random cursors.
      interface  ISeqCursor<T extends IRecord>
      Common interface for all sequential cursors.
      interface  IValidator<T extends IRecord>
      Common interface for all the validators.
      interface  IValidatorListener<T extends IRecord>
      Used by validators to report errors.
      class  MDB<T extends IRecord>
      Base class for all the MDB generated classes.
      class  MDBList<T extends IRecord>
      Base class for all MDB based lists.
      class  ValidationArgs<T extends IRecord>
      Arguments of a validation method.
      class  ValidatorError<T extends IRecord>
      Contains the information of a validation error.
      Fields in org.mfg.mdb.runtime declared as IRecord 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      T[] MDB.NO_DATA
      An array with 0 records.
      Methods in org.mfg.mdb.runtime that return IRecord 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IRecord IRecord.clone()
      Create a deep clone of the record.
      abstract T[] MDB.getRecentRecordsBuffer()
      Get the buffer.
      T[] MDB.select_sparse(IRandomCursor<T> randCursor, ISeqCursor<T> seqCur, long start, long stop, int maxLen)
      This is a similar method to MDB.select(ISeqCursor, long, long), but instead of retrieve all the data from start to stop it retrieves only a fixed number of records ( maxLen).
      T[] MDB.select(ISeqCursor<T> cur, long start, long stop)
      Build an array with all the records in the range from position start to stop.
      T[] MDB.selectAll(ISeqCursor<T> cur)
      Build an array with all the records.
